context_bundle.summary: Puppet declarative configuration management using master-agent architecture or standalone (puppet apply). Manifests (.pp files) define resource state: package, service, file, user. Modules organize code (manifests/, files/, templates/). Puppet DSL: resource { 'title': attribute => value }. Catalog compilation ensures idempotency. Hiera for data separation. Facter collects system facts. PuppetDB stores state.

onboarding.quick_start: Puppet manifest syntax: package { 'nginx': ensure => installed } service { 'nginx': ensure => running, enable => true } file { '/etc/nginx/nginx.conf': source => 'puppet:///modules/nginx/nginx.conf' }. Standalone: puppet apply manifest.pp. Master-agent: puppetserver for master, puppet agent on nodes. Modules: /etc/puppetlabs/code/environments/production/modules/. Hiera data: /etc/puppetlabs/code/environments/production/data/. Facts: facter os, facter ipaddress.
common_patterns: Service: service { 'nginx': ensure => running, enable => true }
